entry.title: ABAP News for SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2508
entry.content:
In this blog, you'll learn about the new features for SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2508 that were documented in the ABAP keyword documentation, ABAP data models documentation, and the ABAP development documentation.

ABAP CDS

CDS Table Entity, Table Buffering

Table buffering can now be defined for CDS table entities. To turn table buffering on or off, use the syntax:

@AbapCatalog.entityBuffer.definitionAllowed: true|false

You can define the buffering type with a CDS table entity buffer using the syntax:

DEFINE TABLE ENTITY BUFFER ON cds_table_entity ...

More about table buffering for CDS table entities

ABAP SQL

Spatial Functions

Spatial functions are now available in ABAP SQL. Spatial data can be accessed, manipulated, and analyzed using spatial functions. The implemented functions are mapped to the methods, functions, and constructors for spatial data in SAP HANA. An example can look like this:

DELETE FROM my_demo_table. 
INSERT my_demo_table FROM @( VALUE #( 
  point1 = `010100002000000000E561A1D634A748400D71AC8BDB482140` 
  point2 = `0101000020000000006919A9F754BC49408A20CEC3090C1F40` ) ). 
 
SELECT st_distance( point1, point2 ) 
       FROM my_demo_table
       INTO TABLE @FINAL(distance).

More about spatial functions

RAP BDL

RAP Change Documents

With RAP change documents, you can log changes of persisted RAP BO data in a change document object.

More about RAP change documents

Random Numbers and Probability Distributions

With this release, ABAP supports versatile random number generation and can compute with probabilities.

More about random numbers and probability distributions
Blog about random numbers and probability distributions

ABAP Development Guide

Learning ABAP can be a challenge, which is why we invested in an ABAP development guide. This guide aims to explain ABAP from the basics and with simple terminology. The first two topics are now available, covering the ABAP syntax and internal tables. Two familiar topics are also explained there: the controlled SAP LUW and the background processing framework. We would love your feedback and learn if this guide helps you. Feel free to reply to this post.

ABAP Development Guide

New Terms

The following new terms are used.

TermDefinition
RAP reorder actionA RAP non-standard operation for associations that moves a hierarchy node to a dedicated position among its siblings in editable treeview scenarios. The reorder action can be managed or unmanaged.
RAP nonstandard operation for associationsAn operation for associations that provides noncanonical behavior along an association path from an association source to an association target. For example, the link action, the unlink action, the reorder action, and the inverse function are predefined nonstandard operations for associations.
RAP standard operation for associationsOperation for associations that provides canonical behavior along an association path from an association source to an association target. Create-by-association and read-by-association are standard operations for associations.
RAP operation for associationsA RAP BO operation that operates along an association path and affects the association target. They are defined in the RAP behavior definition for the association. There are standard operations for associations and non-standard operations for associations.

If you have any questions, feel free to comment below. We hope you enjoy the new features.

entry.title: Re: Why work order is not getting triggered from Ik11 for...
entry.content:
To your question "Why the Work Order Was Not Triggered", the answer is You‚Äôve set the call horizon to 100%, which means the system will schedule the call only when the full cycle (250 hours) is reached. However, IP10 doesn‚Äôt generate the order automatically; it only schedules the plan. The actual call (work order creation) happens when the counter reading reaches or exceeds the planned value and the plan is executed via IP30 or IP10 with call creation active.

IP10 shows the planned dates based on the annual estimate and cycle. It does not create the work order unless you explicitly execute the call. The earliest call date being 25 days ahead is based on the estimated usage (3650 hours/year = ~10 hours/day), so 250 hours ‚âà 25 days.

You entered a reading of 750 hours, which crosses the first cycle (250 hours). But if the measurement document was entered after the plan was scheduled, the system may not have recalculated the call due to timing mismatch. SAP uses the latest measurement document to determine whether the call point has been reached;  and if the plan wasn‚Äôt re-executed after that, no call is triggered.

What you should do is

  • Execute IP30 for the maintenance plan with Call creation active and Scheduling period = 1 day. This will check the latest counter reading and trigger the work order if the threshold is crossed.
  • Ensure that the IK17 entry was made before running IP10/IP30. If not, re-run IP30 after entering the latest reading.
  • Go to IP03 and check the status of the maintenance plan. Make sure it‚Äôs active and not in a status that prevents call creation (e.g., completed or inactive).

entry.title: Re: Showing Statistical Forecast Details in the Planner W...
entry.content:
Dear fellow experts.

Even if you add all authorizations to your business role, there are still various pre-requisites to get the enablement working:

  1. Customers obtain the new AI Units (SKU 8019164). They can obtain more than needed, since these Units can later be used for other premium AI features, too, even in other SAP products. So please check if your customer currently have this SKU.
  2. Customers assigns Joule Premium for SCM to the relevant users, using the AI Units. Assignment is done on a per-user-per-month basis. 
  3. Customers activate Premium AI feature "AI-assisted Forecast Result Analysis‚Äù in SAP for Me. There, they get redirected to ServiceNow to open an incident for application component SCM-IBP-DM-STF, requesting SAP to enable the premium AI feature in the corresponding IBP tenant.
  4. SAP will configure the system, and get back to the customer with instructions related to authorization.

I hope the above can be helpful in case you are interested in getting the feature activated for your customers.

Kind regards,
Vincent Verheyen

entry.title: Re: In subcontracting, is it possible to post the goods r...
entry.content:
Hello @0uTY 

This error is understandable given the setup you‚Äôre attempting. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, subcontracting is only supported with production BOMs (Bill of Materials) that are linked to a material master flagged for subcontracting. The standard test script you mentioned (scope item BMY ‚Äì Subcontracting) is designed around that logic.

A Sales BOM is strictly an SD Sales and Distribution concept.:

  • It‚Äôs surged in sales documents, sales orders, delivery, and billing,
  • However, it has no inventory or stock relevance at the parent level.

That‚Äôs why, when you attempt to post a GR against the Sales BOM parent, the system invalidates the process with an error regarding the absence of special stock O (supplier) for the components because it searches for subcontracting stock relationships that are not present for Sales BOMs.

So, here's the scoop:

  • It's not possible to directly use the Sales BOM parent item when doing subcontracting GR. Let me know if you'd like help exploring alternative options!
  • If your scenario involves procurement with subcontracting, you need to use a production BOM material that references components for subcontracting.
  • The error itself is intentional. Sales BOMs aren‚Äôt equipped to handle subcontracting special stock.

If you're looking to replicate this process, you might want to model the material in MM using a production BOM rather than a sale BOM or consider exploring a customised extension for more tailored solutions.

Check below SAP Documentation

Scope Item BMY ‚Äì Subcontracting SAP Learning

Subcontracting Cockpit (APP F2948)

Change Outbound Delivery(APP VL02N)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Should SDF for Singapore recalculate in retroactive a...
entry.content:
Hi @SianWray 

The answer lies in how SDL/SDF Relevant Earnings (/107) are defined in Singapore payroll compared to Ordinary Wages (/102) and Additional Wages (/10):

  1. Here are differences in Cumulation
  • /102: Are regular, recurring wages for example basic salary, allowances, etc. are subject to CPF.
  • /103: Are rregular, non-recurring payments for example bonuses, commissions, leave encashment, etc. are subject to CPF, with annual AW cap considerations.
  • /107: Is used solely for calculating Skills Development Levy. The CPF Board definition for SDL is total wages (all remuneration including OW and AW) but in SAP payroll, /107 may include slightly broader or different wage types than those contributing to /102 or /103, depending on how the wage types are classified.
  1. To your question, should They Match? Answer is not necessarily. However, take note:
  • In most implementations, all wage types that cumulate to OW (/102) and AW (/103) should also cumulate to SDF Relevant Earnings (/107), because SDL is based on total wages.
  • However, /107 can additionally include wage types that are not CPF-liable, for example certain allowances or benefits which the CPF Board exempts from CPF contributions but which are still SDL-liable.

This is why you may see some wage types in /107 but not in /102 or /103.

  1. Here is what i think you should consider doing
  1. Make sure to confirm if the wage types (Singapore SDL rules) in question are SDL-liable but not CPF-liable.
  2. Then compare against SAP configuration guides. SAP‚Äôs delivered Singapore payroll schema includes preconfigured cumulations for SDL but customer-specific wage types may need manual alignment.
  3. You need to ensure consistency:
    • If a wage type is CPF-liable, it must be in /102 or /103 and also in /107.
    • If a wage type is not CPF-liable but SDL-liable, it will only appear in /107.
    • If a wage type is in /107 but not SDL-liable, that is a misconfiguration and should be corrected.

Best regards

Chris

Computing the Contribution Amount

Use of Wage Types in Payroll (Report RPDLGA20)

entry.title: Top 10 SAP Cloud ALM News August 2025
entry.content:
Get ready to explore the newest developments in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation and operations! As August is coming to an end, we're happy to share our TOP 10 Features of the Month, designed to transform your application lifecycle management experience!

 

IMPLEMENTATION UPDATES

1. Streamline your Testing Process with Enhanced Test Case Management

You can now find out whether your manual test case was created manually or imported from an external system with the new Source field in the test case editor. This helps you quickly identify the test cases that have been transferred into SAP Cloud ALM from a different source, for example from SAP Solution Manager. Additionally, it lets you easily navigate to the source system via the included link.

 

2. Enhanced Process Owner Assignment with Mass Edit

You are now able to modify the process owner for multiple solution processes in one action by utilizing the existing Mass Edit button within the Processes app. This can be useful if you need to make multiple changes at once based on Process Hierarchy or Country/Region assignments, for instance.  You can change the process owner assignments in both display mode and Edit Scope mode by selecting one or more solution processes and choosing Mass Edit. The following values are possible:   

  • <Keep Values>: This default value leaves current assignments unchanged. 
  • <Clear Values>: Unassigns the previous process owners for the selected entries. 
  • Name of current user: Choose this to assign yourself as process owner for all selected entries. 
  • Select Other User: Displays a search field allowing you to assign another user as process owner.   

Note

  • The entries made here overwrite any previous assignments for the selected solution processes, even for solution processes that are not currently scoped or have never been scoped before.
  • For performance reasons, only the first 100 entries are currently mass edited regardless of how many rows are selected. This may be particularly relevant for users using the Edit Scope function.

 

3. Introducing the Document Distribution Dashboard

The Document Distribution app offers an overview of documents across various dimensions such as type, priority, and owner, utilizing horizontal bar charts for easy visualization. The app provides navigation and filtering options, enhancing document management efficiency within SAP Cloud ALM. By using this feature, you can quickly identify, prioritize, and manage your documents more effectively, leading to streamlined workflows and improved productivity.

 

4. New supported solution scenario available

The solution scenario Automotive JIT Integration with Logistics Component Groups is now available and has been added to the list of supported solutions for Process Management.

 

5. Tag Assignment now available in Test Plans

You can now assign tags to your test plans. Simply select a test plan from the list, choose Edit, and add or create relevant tags in the General Information section. With tags, you can conveniently group test plans based on a common attribute, making it easy to search and filter for related test plans in the list view.

Note

Tags created within the Test Plans app will be automatically deleted if they are no longer associated with any SAP Cloud ALM object.

 

6. Structured Document Approval Workflow

The controlled document approval workflow ensures that your documents follow a structured approval process within the Documents application. This strengthens the compliance of your SAP Cloud ALM projects. To indicate that a document requires approval, enable the Approval feature.

Further changes depend on the document's approval state, which users can modify, for example, to Start Approval, Cancel, Approve, or Reject. Once a document is approved or rejected, you can use the Rework option to revert it to the editing stage. For more detailed information, refer to Document Approval.

 

OPERATIONS UPDATES

7. New KPI for SAP SuccessFactors Payroll

There is now a new KPI for SAP SuccessFactors Payroll available that improves your business process monitoring capabilities. You can find The KPI Employees Without Payroll Area Assignment under the end-to-end process Recruit to Retire.

This KPI is automatically activated if the necessary setup steps for SAP SuccessFactors Payroll have been completed, and the relevant data is being generated.

  

8. Enhanced Anomaly Detection for Business Services

You can now configure the Anomaly Detected in the Number of Messages Processed event for Business Services. This event lets you receive notifications or initiate corrective actions when the number of messages processed in a business service rises above or falls below a specific threshold in a defined period. 

To know more about configuring the event, refer to Anomalies Detected in the Number of Messages Processed Event.  To know more about configuring business services, refer to Business Services.

 

9. New generic data provider in the Integration Monitoring Analytics API

A new generic data provider, Integration Monitoring Messages, has been introduced for the Integration Monitoring Analytics API. This data provider enables the collection of all data from the Integration and Exception Monitoring app, independent of the message category. Previously, individual data providers were restricted to a single category, and you had to make multiple calls to collect messages of different categories. With the Integration Monitoring Messages data provider, you can now collect messages of multiple categories in a single call.

Note

It is recommended that you use Integration Monitoring Messages as the data provider while configuring the Integration Monitoring Analytics API. 

To know more about configuring the analytics API, refer to API Guide for SAP Cloud ALM.

 

10. New Status in Action Logs of Intelligent Event Processing

A new status, Pending, has been added to the event action entries in the Action Logs. This status indicates that an event action has been initiated by the app and is awaiting acknowledgement from the related service's end. Below you‚Äôll find the different statuses of an event:

  • Pending: The event action is initiated by the app and is awaiting acknowledgment from the related service's end.
  • Successful: The event action is successfully triggered.
  • Failed: The event action failed to trigger successfully.

---------------------------------------------------

Keep an eye out for upcoming editions where we‚Äôll continue to share the newest innovations and enhancements in SAP Cloud ALM for implementation and operations!

In the meantime, feel free to explore the SAP Help Portal and embrace the chance to transform your business to reach new heights of success! üöÄ

entry.title: Re: I want to display the legend titles on the SAC chart.
entry.content: Thanks for your follow-up. You are correct: the Legend Title option is not available in all chart types in SAC. The Format panel that I mentioned only appears for certain visualisations for example Bar/Column charts and Combination charts. If you do not see the Legend section in your Format panel, it means your selected chart type does not support displaying legend titles directly. Here is what you can do instead: 1. Switch your chart type to one that supports Legend Title for example Column, Bar, Line, Combination. 2. Alternatively, if your chart type does not support it, use a Text widget as a workaround to create a custom legend title above or next to your chart. Best regards Chris Adding legends to charts

entry.title: Re: In subcontracting, is it possible to post the goods r...
entry.content:
To your question "Is It Possible to Use Sales BOM in Subcontracting?", the short answer is Not directly. Sales BOMs are designed for sales and delivery, not for procurement or manufacturing. Therefore, they don‚Äôt support the component-level stock management required for subcontracting.

To achieve your goal in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, here‚Äôs what you can do:

Create a Production BOM for the parent material using Manage Bills of Material app. Ensure the components are stock-managed and available for transfer to the subcontractor.

Create a subcontracting purchase order with item category L. Use Manage Purchase Orders app. Transfer components to vendor using movement type 541 via Transfer Stock to Subcontractor app.

Use Post Goods Receipt for Purchase Order app. The system will consume the components from special stock 'O' and post the GR for the finished material.

entry.title: Re: JDBC (Microsoft SQL) Connectivity issue In SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello,

the port 1106 is most probably the port of your SAP CPI system, the driver wants to establish a connection between the SAP CPI system port 1106 and the SQL Server system port 1433.

Can you please provide the complete connection string and the output of "select @version" from the target SQL Server system. 
Do you know the SAP JVM version your system is using ?

Cheers,
Clas Hortien

entry.title: Garden Update: the raised bed went wild
entry.content:
Quick summer update from the raised bed I built in May:

The whole garden went deep green, the electric slug fence still does its quiet job, and harvests are rolling in.

Our entire garden now offers us, in varying quantities, following things:

Tomatoes, beetroot (US: beets), courgettes (US/AU: zucchini), French beans (AU/US: green beans), peas, carrots, pumpkin (US: sometimes winter squash), cucumber, pepper (US: bell pepper; AU: capsicum), plus plenty of berries: redcurrants (US: red currants), blackcurrants (US: black currants), raspberries, gooseberries, blackberries, and strawberries. In the corners I tucked spring onions (US: green onions / scallions), and around the garden the fruit trees took off: mirabelle plums, greengages, European prune plums, four apple trees, pears, cherries, a walnut tree, and a mulberry tree.

The soil mix from the build post is paying off: roots are straight, the beans keep flowering, and the cucumbers suddenly discovered turbo mode. It‚Äôs the kind of honest, outdoor progress that nicely balances a week of laptops and meetings.

The trees are promising a proper late-summer show. The oval Zwetschgen (European prune plums) are already colouring‚Äîperfect for cake and drying‚Äîand the Mirabellen (mirabelle plums) are starting to blush.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The vegetables were usually prepared as stir-fry vegetables. The simplest way, of course, was with just a little soy sauce and rice, or simply as a raw salad.
The fruit was eaten straight away, frozen or made into jam.
The dehydrator is coming this week, then we can dry the plums, apples and walnuts to make them last longer.

The raised bed has definitely been worth it. Now the last courgettes are being harvested, the apples and pumpkins are ripening and the first leaves are falling from the trees.
It's a lot of work, but it's fun, especially when you can harvest so much and know that the harvest comes from your own garden.
In the next edition, I'll tell you a little bit about our chickens (I was asked about them a few times at UI5con because I posted about them briefly on Bluesky :D).

entry.title: Re: External Processing - Question regarding GR
entry.content:
Why SAP allows GR cancellation even after confirmation is because, SAP treats GR and operation confirmations as independent transactions. Unless you explicitly restrict them, the system will

  • allow GR cancellation via MBST or MIGO,
  • allow confirmation of operations in any sequence (unless sequence control is enforced)
  • not check whether subsequent operations are confirmed before allowing GR reversal

In order to control this, you can explore with BAdI WORKORDER_GOODS_RECEIPT which allows you to control logic during GR posting for production orders. If you want to prevent confirmation of operations before GR is posted, then, BAdI WORKORDER_CONFIRM can enforce operation sequence rules more strictly than standard settings.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public cloud and Warehouse bin migration object
entry.content:
Hi @ST24 

This is a good observation and the confusion may arise from the way the Storage Bin migration object is documented in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Here is what the Migration Object supports

  • In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Warehouse Storage Bin migration object is provided in the Migration Cockpit. However, it does not support creating new storage bins.
  • The migration object is only designed to update existing bins for example, changing descriptions, blocking indicators or assignments.

This is why you see contradictions

  • The template notes the storage bin must already exist is correct. You cannot create a new bin using this migration object.
  • If you try to create one, you will receive the error that ‚ÄúYou cannot create new object in warehouse‚Äù.
  • Conversely, if you attempt to re-upload a bin that already exists without adjusting the update logic, you may also encounter the error ‚ÄúStorage bin already exists‚Äù.

Here is the correct approach to create Storage Bins

  • New storage bins must be created directly in the system using the App: Manage Storage Bins (F4674) or via Mass Maintenance / Upload of Storage Bins which are available in certain scope items.
  • Please note, the migration object is strictly for updating bins, not creating them.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Storage Bin Migration

Manage Storage Bins (F4674)

entry.title: Re: New options to import manual Test Cases into SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
When we upload test case as per method - 2. Get Best Practice Test Cases for S/4HANA, all the scripts in the document gets upload under 1 entity. Even though there are multiple Test Cases/ test scripts, in analysis we see only 1 TC for the entire document.

Eg - You upload excel for 1SG, the test case count would be 1 but in actual there are multiple test scripts under 1SG. If 1 step fails the entire Test Case is displayed as failed, even though if we dig deeper, we might have passed 20 test scripts inside.

While I know we can track by number of steps under Analysis, but Clients usually are more interested in the number of test cases and their status. Also, with so many scripts it is not possible to move the entire test case (ex- 1 SG) in a day, so it lies under In Progress for some days leaving the client uneasy and concerned.

Is there a way or a report where we can see under Analysis the actual test case status. If not, do we have that in roadmap.

entry.title: Re: Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not...
entry.content:
Check the following areas:

  1. Go to AW01N for each asset, Select the relevant depreciation area and fiscal period.  Confirm that planned depreciation exists for the period. If it shows 0.00, no posting will occur
  2. In AS02, check Depreciation key is valid and active, Useful life and start date are correctly maintained, Capitalization date is before the posting period and Asset value exists (check acquisition postings)
  3. Run AJRW to ensure fiscal year change has been executed for the current year. If not done, depreciation won‚Äôt calculate for the new year.
  4. In AFAB, run the depreciation posting for only the affected asset(s) with Test run unchecked, Repeat run active, Restart run if needed. Check the log output for any messages or exclusions

entry.title: Re: Integration of CLM invoices to DRC SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @charlene2 

At present, Contract and Lease Management invoices are not yet integrated with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. This is a known limitation.

 

Here are alternatives You Can Consider

  1. Manual Upload into DRC
  • You can generate the required invoice details from CLM and upload them manually into the DRC reporting cockpit using the supported formats such as XML/CSV, depending on the country-specific requirement.
  • This ensures compliance even though the direct integration is not yet available.
  1. Posting CLM Invoices via FI
  • Ensure that CLM invoices are posted into Accounts Receivable.
  • Once the FI document exists, it can flow into DRC reporting since DRC is integrated with FI/SD billing.
  • This is the standard workaround most customers apply until native CLM‚ÄìDRC integration is delivered.
  1. Custom Extraction
  • If manual upload is not sufficient, you can build a custom report or interface to extract CLM invoices and feed them into the DRC inbound layer.
  • This requires configuration and potentially partner add-ons.

 

Here are some references:

 Document and Reporting Compliance Overview

SAP Note 3297053

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Configure Value Mapping. APP eDocument for a non-loca...
entry.content:
Hi @PChacon 

For non-localised countries in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you are correct that there is no pre-delivered namespace /EDOXX in Configure Value Mapping because SAP does not deliver standard reporting content for those countries.

  1. Here is why the Namespace Is Missing
  • Namespaces /EDOXX are only available for SAP-delivered localisations where Document and Reporting Compliance content exists.
  • For countries without localisation, SAP does not provide this namespace by default.
  1. How to Proceed in Non-Localised Countries. You have two possible extensibility approaches:
  1. Use the Generic BAdIs for Value Mapping
  • SAP provides extensibility via the following Business Add-Ins:
    • EDO_VALUE_MAPPING which helps to implement custom value mapping logic for non-localised scenarios.
    • EDO_FORMAT_MAPPING which aims to enhance mapping for specific formats if you are building your own reporting artefacts.
  • These can be implemented using the Custom Logic app in S/4HANA Cloud.
  1. Custom Namespace Creation
    • In non-localised countries, you must create a custom namespace instead of /EDOXX.
    • This is done in the Configure Value Mapping app but you need to create your own namespace for example /CUSTCA/ for Central America.
    • Once you have defined it, you can use it in your custom reporting artefacts and outbound mapping.

This approach is documented in the following links:

    • SAP Help ‚Äì Configure Value Mapping
    • SAP Help ‚Äì BAdIs for DRC Extensibility
    • Extensibility Options (BAdIs)

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ABAP program to change entry sheets (transaction ML81N, tables ESSR and others)
entry.content:
If you need to update entry sheets by program, here's a simple test program to help you. I used it with S/4HANA ON PREMISE 2023 01 (02/2024) FPS.

The methods are:

  • CONVERT_TABLES_TO_BAPI_PARAM: it converts the tables ESSR, ESLL, ESKN, ESKL into the parameters of BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE
  • COPY: it reads the database tables for one existing entry sheet (method SELECT_TABLES) and calls the method CREATE to create a copy of the existing entry sheet
  • CREATE: it calls BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE
  • DELETE: it calls BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_DELETE
  • GET_DETAIL: it calls BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_GETDETAIL, it returns nothing so it's for debug only.
  • IS_SUCCESS: to simplify the analysis of BAPI result parameter RETURN
  • RELEASE: it calls BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_RELEASE
  • REVOKE_ACCEPTANCE_OF_SES: batch input based on ZCL_TOOL_BI_TRANSACTION (blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/community-project-batch-input-toolbox-for-abap/ba-p/14068601; code: https://github.com/jrgkraus/tool-bi)
  • SELECT_TABLES: it returns the contents of tables ESSR, ESLL, ESKN, ESKL.

Concerning the code to revoke acceptance, it's the same as the one posted here: Re: BAPI to unaccept service entry sheet - SAP Community.

REPORT zzsr2_test.

PARAMETERS p_lblni TYPE essr-lblni DEFAULT '6000066408'.
PARAMETERS getdetai RADIOBUTTON GROUP rb1.
PARAMETERS copy RADIOBUTTON GROUP rb1.
PARAMETERS release  RADIOBUTTON GROUP rb1.
PARAMETERS revoke RADIOBUTTON GROUP rb1 DEFAULT 'X'.
PARAMETERS delete RADIOBUTTON GROUP rb1.

PARAMETERS datrevok TYPE d DEFAULT '20250731'.

CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION DEFERRED.
CLASS lcl_entry_sheet DEFINITION DEFERRED.

START-OF-SELECTION.
  DATA go_app TYPE REF TO lcl_app.

  CREATE OBJECT go_app TYPE ('LCL_APP').
  CALL METHOD go_app->('START_OF_SELECTION').

CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS start_of_selection.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_entry_sheet DEFINITION FINAL CREATE PRIVATE.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    TYPES tt_entrysheetaccountassignment TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiesknc WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheetservices          TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiesllc WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiesklc WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheetservicestexts     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapieslltx WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheetheadertext        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiessrtx WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_esll                        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF esll WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_eskn                        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF eskn WITH DEFAULT KEY.
    TYPES tt_eskl                        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF eskl WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    CLASS-METHODS convert_tables_to_bapi_param
      IMPORTING is_essr                        TYPE essr
                it_esll                        TYPE tt_esll
                it_eskn                        TYPE tt_eskn
                it_eskl                        TYPE tt_eskl
      EXPORTING es_entrysheetheader            TYPE bapiessrc
                et_entrysheetaccountassignment TYPE tt_entrysheetaccountassignment
                et_entrysheetservices          TYPE tt_entrysheetservices
                et_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   TYPE tt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues
                et_entrysheetservicestexts     TYPE tt_entrysheetservicestexts
                et_entrysheetheadertext        TYPE tt_entrysheetheadertext.

    CLASS-METHODS copy
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet        TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
                iv_force_acceptance  TYPE abap_bool DEFAULT abap_false
                iv_force_not_deleted TYPE abap_bool DEFAULT abap_true
      EXPORTING ev_entrysheet        TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
                et_return            TYPE tt_return.

    CLASS-METHODS create
      IMPORTING is_entrysheetheader            TYPE bapiessrc
                it_entrysheetaccountassignment TYPE tt_entrysheetaccountassignment OPTIONAL
                it_entrysheetservices          TYPE tt_entrysheetservices OPTIONAL
                it_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   TYPE tt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues OPTIONAL
                it_entrysheetservicestexts     TYPE tt_entrysheetservicestexts OPTIONAL
                it_entrysheetheadertext        TYPE tt_entrysheetheadertext OPTIONAL
                testrun                        TYPE testrun DEFAULT space
                no_commit                      TYPE char1 DEFAULT space
      EXPORTING ev_entrysheet                  TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
                et_return                      TYPE tt_return.

    CLASS-METHODS delete
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
      EXPORTING et_return     TYPE tt_return.

    "! For debug only - To check the parameters to pass to CREATE
    CLASS-METHODS get_detail
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no.

    CLASS-METHODS is_success
      IMPORTING it_return        TYPE tt_bapiret2
      RETURNING VALUE(rv_result) TYPE abap_bool.

    CLASS-METHODS release
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
      CHANGING  rt_return     TYPE tt_return.

    "! Batch input to revoke acceptance of service entry sheet
    "! based on ZCL_TOOL_BI_TRANSACTION:
    "!   Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/community-project-batch-input-toolbox-for-abap/ba-p/14068601
    "!   Code: https://github.com/jrgkraus/tool-bi
    CLASS-METHODS revoke_acceptance_of_ses
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet  TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
                iv_revoke_date TYPE d DEFAULT sy-datum.

    CLASS-METHODS select_tables
      IMPORTING iv_entrysheet TYPE bapiessr-sheet_no
      EXPORTING es_essr       TYPE essr
                et_esll       TYPE tt_esll
                et_eskn       TYPE tt_eskn
                et_eskl       TYPE tt_eskl.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD start_of_selection.
    SELECT SINGLE lblni, loekz, kzabn
      FROM essr
      WHERE lblni = @p_lblni
      INTO @DATA(ls_essr).
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE '' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CASE abap_true.
      WHEN getdetai.
        " For debug only.
        lcl_entry_sheet=>get_detail( p_lblni ).
      WHEN copy.
        DATA lv_new_entrysheet TYPE essr-lblni.
        DATA lt_return      TYPE tt_return.
        lcl_entry_sheet=>copy( EXPORTING iv_entrysheet            = p_lblni
                                         iv_force_not_deleted = abap_true
                               IMPORTING ev_entrysheet            = lv_new_entrysheet
                                         et_return                = lt_return ).
        IF lv_new_entrysheet IS NOT INITIAL.
          WRITE : / 'Sheet created:', lv_new_entrysheet.
        ELSE.
          WRITE / 'Errors when trying to create sheet:'.
          LOOP AT lt_return REFERENCE INTO DATA(ls_return).
            MESSAGE ID ls_return->id TYPE ls_return->type NUMBER ls_return->number
                    WITH ls_return->message_v1 INTO DATA(lv_texte_message).
            WRITE / lv_texte_message.
          ENDLOOP.
        ENDIF.
      WHEN release.
        lcl_entry_sheet=>release( EXPORTING iv_entrysheet = p_lblni
                                  CHANGING  rt_return     = lt_return ).
        IF lcl_entry_sheet=>is_success( lt_return ).
          WRITE : / 'Sheet released:', p_lblni.
        ELSE.
          WRITE / 'Errors when trying to release sheet:'.
          LOOP AT lt_return REFERENCE INTO ls_return.
            MESSAGE ID ls_return->id TYPE ls_return->type NUMBER ls_return->number
                    WITH ls_return->message_v1 INTO lv_texte_message.
            WRITE / lv_texte_message.
          ENDLOOP.
        ENDIF.
      WHEN revoke.
        " Sheet must be in status "received" (essr-kzabn = 'X').
        " After revoking, status will be "not received" (essr-kzabn = '').
        lcl_entry_sheet=>revoke_acceptance_of_ses( iv_entrysheet  = p_lblni
                                                   iv_revoke_date = datrevok ).
      WHEN delete.
        " Sheet must be in status "not received" (essr-kzabn = '') and not deleted (essr-loekz = '').
        " After being deleted, essr-loekz = 'X'.
        lcl_entry_sheet=>delete( EXPORTING iv_entrysheet = p_lblni
                                 IMPORTING et_return     = lt_return ).
        IF lcl_entry_sheet=>is_success( lt_return ).
          WRITE : / 'Sheet deleted:', p_lblni.
        ELSE.
          WRITE / 'when trying to delete sheet:'.
          LOOP AT lt_return REFERENCE INTO ls_return.
            MESSAGE ID ls_return->id TYPE ls_return->type NUMBER ls_return->number
                    WITH ls_return->message_v1 INTO lv_texte_message.
            WRITE / lv_texte_message.
          ENDLOOP.
        ENDIF.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        write / 'Bug - Ask developer'.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_entry_sheet IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD convert_tables_to_bapi_param.
    DATA ls_eskn                        TYPE REF TO eskn.
    DATA ls_esll                        TYPE REF TO esll.
    DATA ls_eskl                        TYPE REF TO eskl.
    DATA ls_entrysheetaccountassignment TYPE bapiesknc.
    DATA ls_entrysheetservices          TYPE bapiesllc.
    DATA ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   TYPE bapiesklc.

    es_entrysheetheader-person_int = is_essr-sbnamag.
    es_entrysheetheader-person_ext = is_essr-sbnaman.
    es_entrysheetheader-location   = is_essr-dlort.
    es_entrysheetheader-ref_date   = is_essr-lbldt.
    es_entrysheetheader-begdate    = is_essr-lzvon.
    es_entrysheetheader-enddate    = is_essr-lzbis.
    es_entrysheetheader-pckg_no    = is_essr-packno.
    es_entrysheetheader-short_text = is_essr-txz01.
    es_entrysheetheader-po_number  = is_essr-ebeln.
    es_entrysheetheader-po_item    = is_essr-ebelp.
    es_entrysheetheader-acceptance = is_essr-kzabn.
    es_entrysheetheader-fin_entry  = is_essr-final.
    es_entrysheetheader-block_ind  = is_essr-f_lock.
    es_entrysheetheader-score_time = is_essr-pwwe.
    es_entrysheetheader-score_qual = is_essr-pwfr.
    es_entrysheetheader-doc_date   = is_essr-bldat.
    es_entrysheetheader-post_date  = is_essr-budat.
    es_entrysheetheader-ref_doc_no = is_essr-xblnr.
    es_entrysheetheader-accasscat  = is_essr-knttp.
    es_entrysheetheader-comm_no    = is_essr-user1.
    es_entrysheetheader-user_field = is_essr-user2.

    LOOP AT it_eskn REFERENCE INTO ls_eskn.
      CLEAR ls_entrysheetaccountassignment.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-pckg_no              = ls_eskn->packno.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-serial_no            = ls_eskn->zekkn.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-gl_account           = ls_eskn->sakto.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-bus_area             = ls_eskn->gsber.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-costcenter           = ls_eskn->kostl.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-sd_doc               = ls_eskn->vbeln.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-itm_number           = ls_eskn->vbelp.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-asset_no             = ls_eskn->anln1.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-sub_number           = ls_eskn->anln2.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-order                = ls_eskn->aufnr.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-co_area              = ls_eskn->kokrs.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-to_costctr           = ls_eskn->xbkst.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-to_order             = ls_eskn->xbauf.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-to_project           = ls_eskn->xbpro.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-cost_obj             = ls_eskn->kstrg.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-profit_segm_no_alpha = ls_eskn->paobjnr.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-profit_ctr           = ls_eskn->prctr.
      WRITE ls_eskn->ps_psp_pnr TO ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-wbs_elem.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-network        = ls_eskn->nplnr.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-routing_no     = ls_eskn->aufpl.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-rl_est_key     = ls_eskn->imkey.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-counter        = ls_eskn->aplzl.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-part_acct      = ls_eskn->vptnr.
*    ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-cmmt_item            = ls_eskn->fipos.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-cmmt_item_long = ls_eskn->fipos.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-rec_ind        = ls_eskn->recid.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-funds_ctr      = ls_eskn->fistl.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-fund           = ls_eskn->geber.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-func_area_long = ls_eskn->fkber.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-res_doc        = ls_eskn->kblnr.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-res_item       = ls_eskn->kblpos.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-grant_nbr      = ls_eskn->grant_nbr.
      ls_entrysheetaccountassignment-budget_period  = ls_eskn->budget_pd.
      INSERT ls_entrysheetaccountassignment INTO TABLE et_entrysheetaccountassignment.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT it_esll REFERENCE INTO ls_esll.
      CLEAR ls_entrysheetservices.
      ls_entrysheetservices-pckg_no          = ls_esll->packno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-line_no          = ls_esll->introw.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ext_line         = ls_esll->extrow.
      ls_entrysheetservices-delete_ind       = ls_esll->del.
      ls_entrysheetservices-service          = ls_esll->srvpos.
      ls_entrysheetservices-outl_level       = ls_esll->rang.
      ls_entrysheetservices-outl_no          = ls_esll->extgroup.
      ls_entrysheetservices-subpckg_no       = ls_esll->sub_packno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-serv_type        = ls_esll->lbnum.
      ls_entrysheetservices-edition          = ls_esll->ausgb.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ssc_item         = ls_esll->stlvpos.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ext_serv         = ls_esll->extsrvno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-quantity         = ls_esll->menge.
      ls_entrysheetservices-base_uom         = ls_esll->meins.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ovf_tol          = ls_esll->uebto.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ovf_unlim        = ls_esll->uebtk.
      ls_entrysheetservices-price_unit       = ls_esll->peinh.
      ls_entrysheetservices-gr_price         = ls_esll->brtwr.
      ls_entrysheetservices-net_value        = ls_esll->netwr.
      ls_entrysheetservices-from_line        = ls_esll->frompos.
      ls_entrysheetservices-to_line          = ls_esll->topos.
      ls_entrysheetservices-short_text       = ls_esll->ktext1.
      ls_entrysheetservices-distrib          = ls_esll->vrtkz.
      ls_entrysheetservices-pers_no          = ls_esll->pernr.
      ls_entrysheetservices-wagetype         = ls_esll->lgart.
      ls_entrysheetservices-pln_pckg         = ls_esll->pln_packno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-pln_line         = ls_esll->pln_introw.
      ls_entrysheetservices-con_pckg         = ls_esll->knt_packno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-con_line         = ls_esll->knt_introw.
      ls_entrysheetservices-tmp_pckg         = ls_esll->tmp_packno.
      ls_entrysheetservices-tmp_line         = ls_esll->tmp_introw.
      ls_entrysheetservices-ssc_lim          = ls_esll->stlv_lim.
      ls_entrysheetservices-limit_line       = ls_esll->limit_row.
      ls_entrysheetservices-target_val       = ls_esll->zielwert.
      ls_entrysheetservices-basline_no       = ls_esll->alt_introw.
      ls_entrysheetservices-basic_line       = ls_esll->basic.
      ls_entrysheetservices-alternat         = ls_esll->alternat.
      ls_entrysheetservices-bidder           = ls_esll->bidder.
      ls_entrysheetservices-supp_line        = ls_esll->supple.
      ls_entrysheetservices-open_qty         = ls_esll->freeqty.
      ls_entrysheetservices-inform           = ls_esll->inform.
      ls_entrysheetservices-blanket          = ls_esll->pausch.
      ls_entrysheetservices-eventual         = ls_esll->eventual.
      ls_entrysheetservices-tax_code         = ls_esll->mwskz.
      ls_entrysheetservices-taxjurcode       = ls_esll->txjcd.
      ls_entrysheetservices-price_chg        = ls_esll->prs_chg.
      ls_entrysheetservices-matl_group       = ls_esll->matkl.
      ls_entrysheetservices-external_item_id = ls_esll->externalid.
      ls_entrysheetservices-service_item_key = ls_esll->srvmapkey.
      ls_entrysheetservices-date             = ls_esll->sdate.
      ls_entrysheetservices-begintime        = ls_esll->begtime.
      ls_entrysheetservices-endtime          = ls_esll->endtime.
      ls_entrysheetservices-extpers_no       = ls_esll->persext.
      ls_entrysheetservices-formula          = ls_esll->formelnr.
      ls_entrysheetservices-form_val1        = ls_esll->frmval1.
      ls_entrysheetservices-form_val2        = ls_esll->frmval2.
      ls_entrysheetservices-form_val3        = ls_esll->frmval3.
      ls_entrysheetservices-form_val4        = ls_esll->frmval4.
      ls_entrysheetservices-form_val5        = ls_esll->frmval5.
      ls_entrysheetservices-userf1_num       = ls_esll->userf1_num.
      ls_entrysheetservices-userf2_num       = ls_esll->userf2_num.
      ls_entrysheetservices-userf1_txt       = ls_esll->userf1_txt.
      ls_entrysheetservices-userf2_txt       = ls_esll->userf2_txt.
      ls_entrysheetservices-hi_line_no       = ls_esll->knobj.
      ls_entrysheetservices-extrefkey        = ls_esll->chgtext.
      ls_entrysheetservices-per_sdate        = ls_esll->per_sdate.
      ls_entrysheetservices-per_edate        = ls_esll->per_edate.
      INSERT ls_entrysheetservices INTO TABLE et_entrysheetservices.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT it_eskl REFERENCE INTO ls_eskl.
      CLEAR ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-pckg_no    = ls_eskl->packno.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-line_no    = ls_eskl->introw.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-serno_line = ls_eskl->numkn.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-quantity   = ls_eskl->menge.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-percentage = ls_eskl->wproz.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-net_value  = ls_eskl->netwr.
      ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues-serial_no  = ls_eskl->zekkn.
      INSERT ls_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues INTO TABLE et_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD copy.
    DATA ls_entrysheetheader            TYPE bapiessrc.
    DATA lt_entrysheetaccountassignment TYPE tt_entrysheetaccountassignment.
    DATA lt_entrysheetservices          TYPE tt_entrysheetservices.
    DATA lt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   TYPE tt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues.
    DATA ls_entrysheetservices          TYPE REF TO bapiesllc.
    DATA lt_esll                        TYPE tt_esll.
    DATA ls_essr                        TYPE essr.
    DATA lt_eskn                        TYPE tt_eskn.
    DATA lt_eskl                        TYPE tt_eskl.

    CLEAR ev_entrysheet.
    CLEAR et_return.

    " TODO texts to be read
    select_tables( EXPORTING iv_entrysheet = iv_entrysheet
                   IMPORTING es_essr       = ls_essr
                             et_esll       = lt_esll
                             et_eskn       = lt_eskn
                             et_eskl       = lt_eskl ).

    convert_tables_to_bapi_param( EXPORTING is_essr                        = ls_essr
                                            it_esll                        = lt_esll
                                            it_eskn                        = lt_eskn
                                            it_eskl                        = lt_eskl
                                  IMPORTING es_entrysheetheader            = ls_entrysheetheader
                                            et_entrysheetaccountassignment = lt_entrysheetaccountassignment
                                            et_entrysheetservices          = lt_entrysheetservices
                                            et_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   = lt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues ).
* TODO texts to be created
*     et_entrysheetservicestexts     = lt_entrysheetservicestexts
*     et_entrysheetheadertext        = lt_entrysheetheadertext

    IF iv_force_acceptance = abap_true.
      ls_entrysheetheader-acceptance = abap_true.
    ENDIF.

    IF iv_force_not_deleted = abap_true.
      LOOP AT lt_entrysheetservices REFERENCE INTO ls_entrysheetservices.
        ls_entrysheetservices->delete_ind = abap_false.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.

    create( EXPORTING is_entrysheetheader            = ls_entrysheetheader
                      it_entrysheetaccountassignment = lt_entrysheetaccountassignment
                      it_entrysheetservices          = lt_entrysheetservices
                      it_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   = lt_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues
*                      testrun                        = space
*                      no_commit                      = space
            IMPORTING ev_entrysheet                  = ev_entrysheet
                      et_return                      = et_return ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create.
    CLEAR ev_entrysheet.
    CLEAR et_return.

    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_CREATE'
      EXPORTING
        entrysheetheader            = is_entrysheetheader
       testrun                     = space
       no_commit                   = space
      IMPORTING
        entrysheet                  = ev_entrysheet
      TABLES
        entrysheetaccountassignment = it_entrysheetaccountassignment
        entrysheetservices          = it_entrysheetservices
        entrysheetsrvaccassvalues   = it_entrysheetsrvaccassvalues
        return                      = et_return
        entrysheetservicestexts     = it_entrysheetservicestexts
        entrysheetheadertext        = it_entrysheetheadertext.

    " Success message in RETURN:
    "   TYPE  ID  NUMBER  MESSAGE                            LOG_NO  LOG_MSG_NO  MESSAGE_V1
    "   S     SE  534     Entry sheet 6000066413 created             000000      6000066413
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD delete.
    " This BAPI does a COMMIT WORK.
    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_DELETE'
      EXPORTING entrysheet = iv_entrysheet
      TABLES    return     = et_return.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_detail.
    TYPES tt_entrysheet_account_assignme TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapieskn WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheet_services         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiesll WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheet_srv_accass_value TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapieskl WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_bapireturn1                 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapireturn1 WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheet_header_text      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiessrtx WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_entrysheet_services_texts   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapieslltx WITH EMPTY KEY.

    DATA ls_entrysheet_header           TYPE bapiessr ##NEEDED.
    DATA lt_entrysheet_account_assignme TYPE tt_entrysheet_account_assignme.
    DATA lt_entrysheet_services         TYPE tt_entrysheet_services.
    DATA lt_entrysheet_srv_accass_value TYPE tt_entrysheet_srv_accass_value.
    DATA lt_return                      TYPE tt_bapireturn1.
    DATA lt_entrysheet_header_text      TYPE tt_entrysheet_header_text.
    DATA lt_entrysheet_services_texts   TYPE tt_entrysheet_services_texts.

    " For debug only
    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_GETDETAIL'
      EXPORTING entrysheet                    = iv_entrysheet
                long_texts                    = abap_true
      IMPORTING entrysheet_header             = ls_entrysheet_header
      TABLES    entrysheet_account_assignment = lt_entrysheet_account_assignme
                entrysheet_services           = lt_entrysheet_services
                entrysheet_srv_accass_values  = lt_entrysheet_srv_accass_value
                return                        = lt_return
                entrysheet_header_text        = lt_entrysheet_header_text
                entrysheet_services_texts     = lt_entrysheet_services_texts.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD is_success.
    rv_result = abap_true.
    LOOP AT it_return TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS
         WHERE    type = 'A'
               OR type = 'E'
               OR type = 'X'.
      rv_result = abap_false.
      EXIT.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD release.
    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ENTRYSHEET_RELEASE'
      EXPORTING entrysheet = iv_entrysheet
                rel_code   = ''
*                no_commit_work = space
      TABLES    return     = rt_return.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD revoke_acceptance_of_ses.
    DATA(lo_ml81n) = NEW zcl_tool_bi_transaction( 'ML81N' ).

    " 1st screen of ML81N: click on the Other command button
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0400'
      )->ok_code( '=SELP' ).

    " Popup asking which service sheet to display
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0340'
      )->field( 'RM11R-LBLNI' )->value( iv_entrysheet
      )->ok_code( '=ENTE' ).

    " Screen showing the service sheet in display mode, click on the Edit button
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0400'
      )->ok_code( '=AKCH' ).

    " Screen showing the service sheet in modification mode, click on the Revoke Acceptance button
    " NB: potential errors:
    "   - If the sheet is not accepted (ESSR-KZABN = ''), the Revoke Acceptance button is not shown: The function code cannot be selected (Message No. 00255)
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0400'
      )->ok_code( '=ACCR' ).

    " Screen showing the service sheet in modification mode, click on the Save button
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0400'
      )->ok_code( '=SAVE' ).

    " Popup asking for document date and accounting date
    DATA lv_revoke_date_external_format TYPE c LENGTH 10.
    lv_revoke_date_external_format = |{ iv_revoke_date DATE = USER }|.
    lo_ml81n->new_dynpro(
      )->program( 'SAPLMLSR'
      )->dynpro( '0110'
      )->field( 'IMKPF-BLDAT' )->value( lv_revoke_date_external_format
      )->field( 'IMKPF-BUDAT' )->value( lv_revoke_date_external_format
      )->ok_code( 'ENTE' ).

    DATA lv_mode                    TYPE ctu_params-dismode VALUE 'N'.
    DATA lo_logger                  TYPE REF TO zif_logger.
    DATA lv_result_call_transaction TYPE sysubrc.

    lo_logger = zcl_logger_factory=>create_log( ).
    lo_ml81n->mode( lv_mode )->update( 'L' ).

    lv_result_call_transaction = lo_ml81n->run( lo_logger ).

    IF lv_result_call_transaction <> 0.
      " < 1000 : error message (A or E) during batch input execution,
      " = 1001 : technical error (messages S00341 to S00349)
      lo_logger->popup( ).
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD select_tables.
    DATA lt_packno   TYPE SORTED TABLE OF essr-packno WITH UNIQUE KEY table_line.
    DATA lt_packno_2 TYPE SORTED TABLE OF essr-packno WITH UNIQUE KEY table_line.
    DATA ls_esll     TYPE REF TO esll.

    CLEAR es_essr.
    CLEAR et_esll.
    CLEAR et_eskn.
    CLEAR et_eskl.

    SELECT SINGLE *
      FROM essr
      WHERE lblni = @iv_entrysheet
      INTO @ES_essr.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      message 'Sheet does not exist' type 'I' display like 'E'.
      return.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT *
      FROM eskn
      WHERE packno = @iv_entrysheet
      INTO TABLE @ET_eskn. "#EC CI_SUBRC

    lt_packno = VALUE #( ( es_essr-packno ) ).

    lt_packno_2 = lt_packno.
    WHILE lt_packno_2 IS NOT INITIAL.
      SELECT *
        FROM esll
        FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_packno_2
        WHERE packno = @LT_packno_2-table_line
        APPENDING TABLE @ET_esll. "#EC CI_SUBRC

      lt_packno_2 = VALUE #( ).
      LOOP AT et_esll REFERENCE INTO ls_esll
           WHERE sub_packno IS NOT INITIAL.
        INSERT ls_esll->sub_packno INTO TABLE lt_packno.
        IF sy-subrc = 0.
          INSERT ls_esll->sub_packno INTO TABLE lt_packno_2.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDWHILE.

    IF lt_packno IS NOT INITIAL.
      SELECT *
        FROM eskl
        FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_packno
        WHERE packno = @LT_packno-table_line
        INTO TABLE @ET_eskl. "#EC CI_SUBRC
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Modifiable Transport Requests now also for your SAP cloud changes
entry.content:
Happy to share the availability of a new feature of SAP Cloud Transport Management: with the latest release that went live this week, you can now create modifiable transport requests ‚Äì something many of you might know from the Change and Transport System (CTS) of the ABAP stack, but this time for the SAP cloud changes that are integrated with SAP Cloud Transport Management, such as many changes from SAP BTP.

With this first version of the feature, it is possible to manually create modifiable transport requests. They are not yet fully integrated into other UIs from content providers and into change and deployment management capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM, but we are working with the colleagues to clarify integration options and to define the best flow with change management. But you can already start using it, to gain first experience.

In detail, you can now go to the Transport Requests view in SAP Cloud Transport Management and create a new modifiable transport request by specifying the source node, content type and description.

Creation of modifiable transport request

Think of an open shell you can now use to add content to it ‚Äì for which you can just click on the newly created transport request and navigate to the Content tab and add or change the content you want to propagate. 

Content tab of the modifiable transport request, where you can add or change files attached to it

The idea is that you can now test the transport and the involved changes to a defined scope of test nodes (such as TST and PRE-PROD) - you can adapt the scope of test nodes, but it is not allowed to comprise the final node of your transport landscape, as this is considered to be the production node, where no testing should be allowed. For testing, you go to the Tracking view:

Tracking view of the modifiable transport request, where you also see the scope of test nodes

Based on the outcome of these tests, you can then update the content of the transport (such as by adding further files, exchanging files, removing files, changing the order of comprised files), before testing again until you are fine with the outcome.

Only then, you release the transport request and with this, add it as unmodifiable transport request to the first-level nodes again, but this time as "normal" transport request in status released that you process like any other transport and that can then also go to the last node of your defined transport landscape (considered a production node).

You can find a description of this new feature in SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Re: CO-PA/Margin Analysis update for Revenue project
entry.content:
Hi @Bharat23 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, CO-PA Profitability Analysis is replaced by Margin Analysis. For revenue projects, the update process works as follows:

  1. Posting Logic in Revenue Projects
  • When you post customer billing documents for example from Professional Services revenue projects, the system automatically creates Universal Journal entries ACDOCA.
  • Margin Analysis derives characteristics for example project, WBS element, customer, product, service organisation and updates profitability attributes in the same Universal Journal line item.
  • There is no separate ledger for CO-PA anymore. Everything is harmonised in ACDOCA.
  1. Integration with Project Billing
  • Revenue projects managed in Project Billing BRIM or Professional Services billing, trigger postings to FI-AR and controlling objects.
  • These postings update:
    • Revenue √† recognised in FI and controlling.
    • Costs √† recorded via time/expense postings and allocated to WBS elements.
    • Margin Analysis √† updated with both revenue and cost attributes in real time.
  1. Key Characteristics in Margin Analysis
  • By default, S/4HANA Cloud derives project-relevant fields such as:
    • Project definition / WBS element
    • Profit centre
    • Customer / Market segment
    • Product / Service
  • You can extend these via the Derivation Tool for Margin Analysis. Fiori app Define Derivation Strategy for Margin Analysis.
  1. Reporting
  • Once updated, data is available in embedded SAC stories and Fiori analytical apps such as:
    • Margin Analysis, Actuals F4567
    • Profitability Segment Report
  • This allows you to analyse contribution margins at project level without separate reconciliations.

 

Here are references to further guid you:

Margin Analysis in S/4HANA Cloud

Margin Analysis in S/4HANA Cloud

SAP Note 3049382

To summarise, in S/4HANA Public Cloud, revenue project postings automatically update Margin Analysis via the Universal Journal (ACDOCA). Revenues, costs, and project attributes flow directly into profitability segments in real time, ensuring reporting is always reconciled with FI and CO.

Best regards,
Chris

entry.title: Re: Link Solution Order with Project Item (linked existin...
entry.content:
Hi @Sorosch_Sakhiza 

What you are observing is the current system behaviour in Solution Order Management with project items in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Here are some details to note.

  1. When the Project Is Created from the Solution Order
  • If you create a new project directly through the Solution Order item, the system writes the Solution Order reference into the billing document request automatically.
  • This ensures the link is visible in the ‚ÄúSolution Order‚Äù column of the Create Billing Documents app.
  1. When You Link an Existing Project to the Solution Order
  • If you only assign an existing project to the Solution Order, the reference is not retroactively updated in the billing document request.
  • The linkage at billing level only works if the project was created from the Solution Order. This is by design. No background job or batch update exists to fill the missing reference.
  1. Here are the approach/ Workarounds I recommend
  • For you to have billing document requests show the Solution Order reference:
    • Ensure to always create the project from the Solution Order or Use custom reporting or analytical queries where you can join the Solution Order Item √† Project ID √† Billing Document Request relationship manually.
  • SAP does not currently provide a standard job to ‚Äúbackfill‚Äù the Solution Order reference when linking existing projects.

 

Here are references to further guide you:

Solution Orders in S/4HANA Cloud

Create Billing Documents (Fiori ID F0798A)

SAP Note 3292294

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

However, there are a few alternative approaches and workarounds you can consider; depending on your system flexibility and business needs.

By this, via VKOA combination, you can post the value to the desired G/L Account.  This manual condition type can be inserted either in your existing pricing procedure or new pricing procedure which all depends on your current Business process

entry.title: üåç Smarter SAP SuccessFactors Provisioning: Driving Phased Rollouts with Scoping Filters
entry.content:
Phased vs Big Bang: Using Scoping Filters for SAP SuccessFactors ‚Üí Azure AD Provisioning

About Me

Hare Krishna üôè I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

üåüIntroduction

Provisioning between SAP SuccessFactors (SF) and Azure AD / Entra ID is at the heart of identity lifecycle management.

  • Inbound sync (SAP SF ‚Üí Azure AD) ensures employees and contractors are automatically created, updated, or deactivated in Azure AD.

  • Writeback (Azure AD ‚Üí SAP SF) sends attributes like email, UPN, or group memberships back to SAP SuccessFactors.

Image Source: Microsoft Learn

These jobs often run multiple times a day and need careful sequencing (inbound first, writeback later).

In large organizations, the challenge is not just how often we sync, but who we sync at each stage of the rollout. That‚Äôs where scoping filters make the difference.

üîπWhy Scoping Filters Matter

Without filters, all SAP SF users are provisioned into Azure AD ‚Äî which is fine for small companies, but risky for enterprises with multiple regions, business units, or login methods.

üí°Discussion point:
By using two scoping filters ‚Äî üåê Region and üîë LoginMethod ‚Äî provisioning can be phased, secure, and aligned to project go-lives.

Image Source: Microsoft Learn

‚öôÔ∏èHow to Use Scoping Filters

üîπConfiguring scoping filters in Azure AD is straightforward:

  1. üñ•Ô∏è Go to Enterprise Applications in Azure AD ‚Üí Select your SAP SuccessFactors app.

  2. ‚öôÔ∏èNavigate to Provisioning ‚Üí Mappings.

  3. üìãSelect the user mapping and scroll to Scoping filters.

  4. ‚ûïAdd filter conditions, for example:

    • üåêregion = ‚ÄúAPAC‚Äù

    • üîëloginMethod = ‚ÄúSSO‚Äù

  5. üíæSave and üîÑrestart provisioning to apply.

üîπScoping Filter Flow (Visual)

[SAP SuccessFactors Users] 
          ‚îÇ
          ‚ñº
   üåê Region Filter
          ‚îÇ
          ‚ñº
   üîë LoginMethod Filter
          ‚îÇ
          ‚ñº
[Filtered Users ‚Üí Azure AD / Entra ID]
          ‚îÇ
          ‚ñº
      ‚ö° Writeback (optional)

üìñSymbol Guide:

  • üåê= Region filter

  • üîë= LoginMethod (SSO) filter

  • ‚ö°= Optional writeback attributes

‚ö°Big Bang vs üéØ Phased Rollout

üöÄBig Bang (All Users at Once)

[SAP SuccessFactors] ---> (All Users) ---> [Azure AD / Entra] ---> [On-Prem AD]
‚úÖQuick rollout
‚ö†Ô∏èRisk if data quality issues exist

üéØPhased Rollout (Using Region + LoginMethod Filters)

[SAP SuccessFactors] -(üåê Region + üîë LoginMethod)-> [Filtered User Set] ---> [Azure AD / Entra] ---> [On-Prem AD]

‚úÖRoll out by region or Business Unit
‚úÖOnly SSO-enabled users synced
‚úÖEasier error handling and rollback

üåçPhased Rollout Approach

In large enterprises, a phased rollout is often safer and more manageable than a big bang go-live. With this approach, provisioning from SAP SuccessFactors ‚Üí Azure AD happens in controlled stages.

  • Region Filter : Start with one region (for example, APAC), and once that go-live is stable, keep adding new regions into the filter configuration over time.

  • LoginMethod Filter : Keep this filter set to SSO only so that only employees who authenticate via SSO are synced. This ensures that password-based accounts are not created unnecessarily in AD.

  • Outcome: The combination of region-based phasing and SSO-only filtering ensures that only the intended users are provisioned at each step, reducing risks and avoiding accidental sync of all employees at once.

‚è±Ô∏è Scheduling Insights

  • Run inbound syncs multiple times/day (freshness is key).

  • Schedule writeback jobs after inbound, fewer times/day.

  • Avoid running both simultaneously ‚Üí prevents update collisions.

üèÅConclusion

When integrating SAP SuccessFactors with Azure AD, scoping filters provide a structured way to control the rollout. By applying a region filter, organizations can enable a phased, geography-based approach, while the loginMethod filter ensures that only SSO-enabled employees are provisioned. This combination reduces risk, simplifies troubleshooting, and creates a cleaner identity landscape. For small organizations, a Big Bang rollout may still be effective, but for global enterprises, the phased approach offers a safer and more controlled transition.

‚ùìFAQs

Q1. Can I combine multiple filters (e.g., Region + LoginMethod)?
Yes, filters can be combined so that only specific subsets of SAP SuccessFactors users are provisioned.

Q2. What happens if a user doesn‚Äôt meet the filter condition?
The user remains in SAP SuccessFactors but will not be created in Azure AD.

Q3. Do filters also apply for writeback?
No, filters apply to inbound sync from SAP SuccessFactors to Azure AD. Writeback depends on mapped attributes.

Q4. Should we switch off filters after full rollout?
Yes, once all users are provisioned and stable, filters can be removed for a clean and consistent sync.

üìñReference

Microsoft Learn ‚Äì SAP SuccessFactors inbound provisioning tutorial

entry.title: Re: Manual GL Account Assignment for Billing Transactions
entry.content:
Hello @cgimena 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you cannot manually change the G/L account during billing, which is part of the SD-to-FI integration. Instead, the account determination is smoothly managed through the Account Determination logic and the Revenue Account Determination condition technique, ensuring everything runs seamlessly.

Here are your options to consider!

  • Adjust the account determination setup, including Condition Type ERL, Account Key ERL, and Account Determination Procedure, so the system correctly derives the G/L account.
  • If you need flexibility, utilise substitution rules in Financial Accounting  BAdI FI_ACCOUNT_ASSIGNMENT to modify the account at the time of posting.
  • A manual modification of the billing document itself is not supported in Public Cloud.

No manual G/L account entry in billing, only through customizing condition records or BAdI substitution after posting.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you're unable to manually change the G/L account during billing, which is part of the SD to FI integration. Instead, the account determination is smoothly managed through the Account Determination logic and the Revenue Account Determination condition technique, ensuring everything runs seamlessly.

Your options are:

  • Adjust the account determination setup (Condition Type ERL, Account Key ERL, Account Determination Procedure) so the system derives the correct G/L account.
  • If you need flexibility, utilise substitution rules in Financial Accounting (BAdI FI_ACCOUNT_ASSIGNMENT) to modify the account at the time of posting.
  • A manual modification of the billing document itself is not supported in Public Cloud.

No manual G/L account entry in billing, only through customizing condition records or BAdI substitution after posting.

SAP Help-Revenue Account Determination

Project Control - Enterprise Projects (APP F3215)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Cloud for adv. variant config - professional
entry.content:
Hello @SKAE 

Below clarifies the significance or implication.

  • Measured = 4 ‚Üí Four users in your S/4HANA Cloud tenant have business roles or catalogues that require the S/4HANA Cloud for advanced variant configuration ‚Äì professional licence.
  • Subscribed = 0 ‚Üí Your contract does not include entitlements for that SKU, so the system indicates possible over-consumption.
    Measurement in the Public Cloud is role-based, not user-based, and is determined by the catalogue.

Here's a simple way to identify the 4 users with just two quick checks

IAM Information System app

    • Add the Required Licence column.
    • Filter for the AVC Professional licence.
    • Drill into the roles/catalogues to see the users assigned.

SAP for Me ‚Üí Consumption ‚Üí Cloud Licence Consumption

    • Open your S/4HANA product.
    • Download the user details file to cross-verify the same four users.

Common trigger
For roles involving Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC) modelling applications, such as engineering, research and development, or related content, the AVC ‚Äì Professional licence is required. This ensures you have the right tools and access to excel in these areas.

Resolution options

  • If these users don‚Äôt need AVC modelling: remove or swap the AVC-professional catalogues from their roles.
  • If necessary, buy entitlements for the appropriate number of users.

If you share a screenshot of your IAM filter result, I can identify the specific catalogue(s) responsible for the measurement.

Below are some useful SAP documentation

IAM Information System-SAP Help

Cloud License Consumption reporting in SAP for Me Customer Insights -SAP Community

SAP S/4HANA Cloud for advanced variant configuration

Licence Compliance-SAP Help

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Automating S/4HANA Cloud UI Deployment via CI/CD Pipe...
entry.content:
Hi @niklas-weissenfels 

You are right, the deploy-to-abap task in your ui5-deploy.yaml currently uses re-entrance ticket authentication, which works fine for interactive deployments but not for automated CI/CD pipelines. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you cannot use a re-entrance ticket with a technical user. Instead, you need to switch to service key / OAuth2 token-based authentication using a Communication User and Communication Arrangement.

 

Here are Authentication in Automated Deployments

  • For CI/CD, SAP does not recommend re-entrance tickets.
  • The supported option is to configure OAuth 2.0 with S/4HANA Cloud via a Communication Arrangement.
  • You create a Communication User which is the technical user and generate credentials such as client ID, client secret and token URL.

Here is a communication scenario you can use

  • For deploying UI5/Fiori applications into S/4HANA Public Cloud, you should use Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0466 (Software Lifecycle Management  Extensibility).
  • This allows deployment of extensions into the ABAP system with a service key, not a re-entrance ticket.

Here are CI/CD Configuration Steps to consider

  1. In S/4HANA Cloud:
    • Create a Communication User.
    • Create a Communication System.
    • Create a Communication Arrangement for SAP_COM_0466 and assign your user.
    • This gives you the OAuth token service URL, client ID and secret.
  2. In your CI/CD pipeline:
    • Use these credentials to request an OAuth token from the S/4HANA Cloud token endpoint.
    • Configure ui5-deploy.yaml with authentication Type: oauth2 instead of re-entrance Ticket.
  3. Run Fiori deploy in the pipeline with the OAuth token.

These references provide more details

Deploying UI5 Applications with deploy-to-abap

Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0466

SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
Hello @MKreitlein , 

The change of login to SAP¬¥s digital platforms is mainly necessary from a technical viewpoint. It simplifies the authentication in general as it streamlines with SAP¬¥s  authentication mechanism (SAP IAS). And it is paving the way to further developments as you can read in our News Article, that is also linked above. The transition should be regarded from this broader perspective. 

To get a better understanding where we are going with the authentication to digital platforms, also this interview on YouTube might be interesting for you. 

Nevertheless, the SAP Universal ID remains active: Users can link their user identities (S-/P-users), they can have their SAP Universal ID linked to a personal email address, which helps them preserve learning certifications and community reputation regardless of organizational changes.

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA , SAP Analytics Cloud ,  Artificial Intelligence , SAP Business Technology Platform , within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2‚Äì3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP‚Äôs mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via üëâ  SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP‚Äôs social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

Written by Valentina Guevara.

entry.title: Re: Buyoffs in SAP Digital Manufacturing: Streamlining Approvals and Enhancing Compliance
entry.content:
Hi, see some thoughts below:

  1. I see your buyoff has too many assignments and one of them could be wrong, causing the issue; I suggest you start simple, add a single assignment to material or work center, for example, and retry. Later on you can add more assignments and retest.

  2. Buyoff is triggered on Complete. In your last screenshot, I see the SFC is still active and in the top right corner a red "1" for an error is shown, but I can¬¥t tell which error is it, so I assume you tried to complete and got an error, which might give um a hint on what is wrong.
  3. As I see 'Charge' and 'Phase' in your screenshot, I assume you are running a Process Order, and I¬¥m afraid buyoff doesn't support Process Orders, only Production Orders.

If you still find any issues, I suggest you raise a ticket for further investigation and support.

Hope it helps! Br, Manoel
